      • allConnectionClosed

        public boolean allConnectionClosed()
        The method tests if all resources (JDBC connection and store resources) are closed, that means that the resources are freeed and returned for reuse.
        Returns:
        true if all resources are closed, otherwise false is returned
        See Also:
        connectionStore, storeStore

      • close

        public void close()
        Close this contexts, meaning this context object is removed as thread context.
        If not all connection are closed, all connection are closed.

           throws EFapsException
        Method to abort the transaction.
        Throws:
        EFapsException - if setting of rollback was not successfully

      • getConnectionResource

        public ConnectionResource getConnectionResource()
                                         throws EFapsException
        Returns a opened connection resource. If a previous close connection resource already exists, this already existing connection resource is returned.
        Returns:
        opened connection resource
        Throws:
        EFapsException - if connection resource cannot be created

      • getPersonId

        public long getPersonId()
        If a person is assigned to this context, the id of this person is returned. Otherwise the default person id value is returned. The method guarantees to return value which is valid!
        The value could be used e.g. if a a value is inserted into the database and the person id is needed for the creator and / or modifier.
        Returns:
        person id of current person or default person id value

      • containsRequestAttribute

        public boolean containsRequestAttribute(String _key)
        Returns true if request attributes maps one or more keys to the specified object. More formally, returns true if and only if the request attributes contains at least one mapping to a object o such that (o==null ? o==null : o.equals(o)).
        Parameters:
        _key - key whose presence in the request attributes is to be tested
        Returns:
        true if the request attributes contains a mapping for given key, otherwise false
        See Also:
        requestAttributes, getRequestAttribute(java.lang.String), setRequestAttribute(java.lang.String, java.lang.Object)

      • getRequestAttribute

        public Object getRequestAttribute(String _key)
        Returns the object to which this request attributes maps the specified key. Returns null if the request attributes contains no mapping for this key. A return value of null does not necessarily indicate that the request attributes contains no mapping for the key; it's also possible that the request attributes explicitly maps the key to null. The containsRequestAttribute(java.lang.String) operation may be used to distinguish these two cases.
        More formally, if the request attributes contains a mapping from a key k to a object o such that (key==null ? k==null : key.equals(k)), then this method returns o; otherwise it returns null (there can be at most one such mapping).
        Parameters:
        _key - key name of the mapped attribute to be returned
        Returns:
        object to which the request attribute contains a mapping for specified key, or null if not specified in the request attributes
        See Also:
        requestAttributes, containsRequestAttribute(java.lang.String), setRequestAttribute(java.lang.String, java.lang.Object)

      • setRequestAttribute

        public Object setRequestAttribute(String _key,
                         Object _value)
        Associates the specified value with the specified key in the request attributes. If the request attributes previously contained a mapping for this key, the old value is replaced by the specified value.
        Parameters:
        _key - key name of the attribute to set
        _value - _value of the attribute to set
        Returns:
        Object
        See Also:
        requestAttributes, containsRequestAttribute(java.lang.String), getRequestAttribute(java.lang.String)

      • containsSessionAttribute

        public boolean containsSessionAttribute(String _key)
        Returns true if session attributes maps one or more keys to the specified object. More formally, returns true if and only if the session attributes contains at least one mapping to a object o such that (o==null ? o==null : o.equals(o)).
        Parameters:
        _key - key whose presence in the session attributes is to be tested
        Returns:
        true if the session attributes contains a mapping for given key, otherwise false
        See Also:
        sessionAttributes, getSessionAttribute(java.lang.String), setSessionAttribute(java.lang.String, java.lang.Object)

      • getSessionAttribute

        public Object getSessionAttribute(String _key)
        Returns the object to which this session attributes maps the specified key. Returns null if the session attributes contains no mapping for this key. A return value of null does not necessarily indicate that the session attributes contains no mapping for the key; it's also possible that the session attributes explicitly maps the key to null. The containsSessionAttribute(java.lang.String) operation may be used to distinguish these two cases.
        More formally, if the session attributes contains a mapping from a key k to a object o such that (key==null ? k==null : key.equals(k)), then this method returns o; otherwise it returns null (there can be at most one such mapping).
        Parameters:
        _key - key name of the mapped attribute to be returned
        Returns:
        object to which the session attribute contains a mapping for specified key, or null if not specified in the session attributes
        See Also:
        sessionAttributes, containsSessionAttribute(java.lang.String), setSessionAttribute(java.lang.String, java.lang.Object)

      • setSessionAttribute

        public Object setSessionAttribute(String _key,
                         Object _value)
        Associates the specified value with the specified key in the session attributes. If the session attributes previously contained a mapping for this key, the old value is replaced by the specified value.
        Parameters:
        _key - key name of the attribute to set
        _value - value of the attribute to set
        Returns:
        Object
        See Also:
        sessionAttributes, containsSessionAttribute(java.lang.String), getSessionAttribute(java.lang.String)

      • getUserAttribute

        public String getUserAttribute(String _key)
                        throws EFapsException
        This method retrieves a UserAttribute of the Person this Context belongs to. The UserAttributes are stored in the sessionAttributes Map, therefore are thought to be valid for one session.
        Parameters:
        _key - key to Search for
        Returns:
        String with the value
        Throws:
        EFapsException - on error

      • containsUserAttribute

        public boolean containsUserAttribute(String _key)
                              throws EFapsException
        This method determines if UserAttribute of the Person this Context belongs to exists.The UserAttributes are stored in the sessionAttributes Map, therefore are thought to be valid for one session.
        Parameters:
        _key - key to Search for
        Returns:
        true if found, else false
        Throws:
        EFapsException - on error

      • setUserAttribute

        public void setUserAttribute(String _key,
                    String _value)
                      throws EFapsException
        Set a new UserAttribute for the UserAttribute of the Person this Context.The UserAttributes are stored in the sessionAttributes Map, therefore are thought to be valid for one session.
        Parameters:
        _key - Key of the UserAttribute
        _value - Value of the UserAttribute
        Throws:
        EFapsException - on error

        Set a new UserAttribute for the UserAttribute of the Person this Context.The UserAttributes are stored in the sessionAttributes Map, therefore are thought to be valid for one session.
        Parameters:

      • getThreadContext

        public static Context getThreadContext()
                                throws EFapsException
        The method checks if for the current thread a context object is defined. This found context object is returned.
        Returns:
        defined context object of current thread
        Throws:
        EFapsException - if no context object for current thread is defined
        See Also:
        INHERITTHREADCONTEXT

            boolean _inherit)
                     throws EFapsException

      • begin

        public static Context begin(String _userName,
            Locale _locale,
            Map<String,Object> _sessionAttributes,
            Map<String,String[]> _parameters,
            Map<String,Context.FileParameter> _fileParameters,
            boolean _inherit)
                     throws EFapsException
        For current thread a new context object must be created.
        Parameters:
        _userName - name of current user to set
        _locale - locale instance (which language settings has the user)
        _sessionAttributes - attributes for this session
        _parameters - map with parameters for this thread context
        _fileParameters - map with file parameters
        _inherit - must the context be inherited to child threads
        Returns:
        new context of thread
        Throws:
        EFapsException - if a new transaction could not be started or if current thread context is already set
        See Also:
        INHERITTHREADCONTEXT

                 throws EFapsException

        Throws:

      • isTMActive

        public static boolean isTMActive()
                          throws EFapsException
        Is the status of transaction manager active?
        Returns:
        true if transaction manager is active, otherwise false
        Throws:
        EFapsException - if the status of the transaction manager could not be evaluated

                                 throws EFapsException

      • reset

        public static void reset()
                  throws StartupException
        Resets the context to current defined values in the Javax naming environment.
        Throws:

        See Also:
        DBTYPE, DATASOURCE, TRANSMANAG, TRANSMANAGTIMEOUT
